c. Threatened abortion
The following are the signs of threatened abortion:
 ∙ There is light bleeding.
 ∙ The woman complains of lower abdominal pain.
 ∙ There is no history of expulsion of POC.
 ∙ Abdominal examination shows the uterus to be softer than normal, and the fundal height corresponds to the 
period of gestation.
 ∙ On P/V examination, the cervical os is found to be closed.
Management:
 ∙ If the bleeding decreases or stops, explain the facts to the woman, reassure her and advise
